title: Enforce static code analysis checks for pull requests.
body: This includes proper formatting and clippy warnings.

title: Use non-deprecated Ubuntu 18.04 when executing the tests
Fix all clippy warnings
Cache data directory for executing the search tests
body: This should speed up the tests. The downside, that only the search functionality and not the import is tested, has already been solved by a previous change. Also, the very slow RIDGES import has been deactivated already. This PR adapts the queries from the RIDGES corpus to other corpora.

title: Add tests for importing relANNIS files
body: This compares the import of a sample corpus via relANNIS with one performed by GraphML. This adds an explicit integration test for the relANNIS importer and allows to use a faster import mechanism for the indirect search tests (which primary should test the AQL execution).

title: Always compile cli and import relANNIS files.
body: Importing the relANNIS files is part of the tests. Otherwise the relANNIS import would be undertested

title: Update several dependencies
Improve CI execution time
Implement operator negation with existence assumption
body:
This implements #186 by splitting the current `BinaryOperator` trait into two traits (one that can only be used with nested loop joins and one that can be used with index joins) and adding an automatic implementation of the negated variant for each existing binary operator. This can only use the `filter_match` function, since there is no way to automatically find optimized implementations for the negation. A (slow) nested loop join is enforced instead. Since the current implementation of the negated operators are non-binding (as defined in #186), this is not  an issue since in most cases this will be an additional filter function and not be used to generate new right-hand-side matches for a given left-hand-side.

TO-DOs

- [x] Fix issues reported by clippy in the changed files
- [x] run benchmark to ensure no existing query is affected
- [x] add specific test queries for the new operator

title: Assume that the annis::node_name annotation is unique when estimating match size
Add 0 to default available context sizes.
body: This fixes #181 for corpora imported from relANNIS.

title: Ignore missing files directory when getting the linked files.
body:
We canonicalize the path to the files directory, but this assumes it exists.
An error was thrown when it did not, which is changed to an optional value in this PR.

title: Fix issues in C-API header
body: These issues are related to the Python API, which does some checks when parsing the header.

title: Add `export_to_fs` function to C-API
Synchronize REST API error output for bad AQL requests with the OpenAPI specification
Use the new SmallVec-based MatchGroup type instead of Vec<Match>
It should not be necessary for both the expected size and the limit to be present to allocate a memory-aligned vector
Add possibility to re-optimize imported corpora
Don't percent encode m ":" in match string when quirks mode is active
Inline strings for annotation names and values
Implement search query timeout
body: This allows to abort long-running queries after a given timeout and is an API change.

title: Use typed errors instead of anyhow:Error in libraries
Limit vector size capacity based on query estimation.
Add the possibility to change the amount of RAM used for the corpus cache in the web service.
body: This also changes the `FixedMaxMemory` variant of the `CacheStrategy` enum to use Megaybtes instead of bytes.

title: Use a thread local instance of the AQL parser to avoid leaking memory when regular expression cache of lalrpop is repeatedly called.
Decode corpus names before listing them.
body: We already make sure corpus names with non-ASCII characters are supported by encoding their directory name. When listing them we need to decode them, otherwise e.g. the REST API won't allow any search form them because their existince ist first checked.

title: Adding workaround for duplicated document names when importing invalid relANNIS corpora
